groups.name: Things That Grow from a Bulb

easy.notes: Easy categories: (1) Things with Wings (objects that fly or have wings). (2) Things You Sit On (furniture used for seating). (3) Morning Habits (common daily routines). (4) Things That Grow from a Bulb (plants started from bulbs). Near-miss temptation: 'flower' could fit more than one group but each item here fits a single clear category.

medium.notes: Medium categories: (1) Prefix 'un-' as in words meaning 'not' (unfold, unseen, untied, untold). (2) Suffix '-ful' indicating 'full of' (careful, hopeful, colorful, playful). (3) Color-related items where color is a clear cue (orange, lime, blue/blueberry, scarlet). (4) Compound words made by joining two simpler words (sunrise, rainbow, backyard, homework). Near-miss temptation: some items could fit both prefix and suffix groups if not careful, but each item belongs to the intended single group with a precise definition.

hard.notes: Hard categories: (1) Earth and Sky Map uses concepts like directions and weather/sky elements as group cues. (2) Tiny Helpers includes small workers in nature; each is clearly linked to a planet-friendly role. (3) Fastest Movers collects fast land/air animals for a speed-theme. (4) Kitchen Drawer items are everyday tools grouped by common use. Near-miss temptation: 'spoon' could be mistaken for a cooking tool in multiple groups, but in this puzzle it clearly belongs to Kitchen Drawer tools; other items are not kitchen tools, reducing overlap. The items are kept kid-friendly and unambiguous.
